topic.title: Encrypt a URL on Zeronet (or clearnet)
topic.body: New tool, just developed. Encrypt a URL seamlessly with 256 bit AES encryption to block Facebook, Twitter and other content scraping robots. Available on clearnet as well. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JZ9nUNpAYt4Z4y2AFtchR2xg9W8e9jAeD

1567094528_18dieCoQDjEdHGwGJt3g4zX4S78Gj.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_807_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Ok, now what about redirecting to the encrypted URL? This will make URLCrypt something like a shortener.

I may be unsure what you mean, because it does already redirect on decryption (or it should!)

There are data storage and security reasons why I am intentionally not adding a shortner..

> [concernednetizen](#comment_1_18dieCoQDjEdHGwGJt3g4zX4S78GjQjvFY): I may be unsure what you mean, because it does already redirect on decryption (or it should!) [...]

now, testing in TOR browser I replicated the location not being updated.

thanks for pointing out the bug, gitcenter!

> [gitcenter](#comment_810_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Please tell me when you fix the bug, by the way.

I added a HREF since the location bar isn't updated due to the bug created when I ported it to zeroframe

I guess I need to know what field to update instead of document.location

anyone have an idea?

> [gitcenter](#comment_811_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): parent.location.href

bingo -- thank you very much!

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JZ9nUNpAYt4Z4y2AFtchR2xg9W8e9jAeD/decrypt.html?u=U2FsdGVkX18aQsbyxLwTKqsWZSVZgr+OawzEojVUTpOHEbiA8jA70NpD35pzfyFu
